+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): Useful feature for users to see folder content size at a glance.\nApproach: Add 'ShowConnectionCount' setting to OptionsAppearancePage. Update ConnectionNameFormatter.FormatName to append child count to folder names if enabled.\nAI triage (gemini): Enhances usability by allowing users to quickly see the number of connections within folders in the tree view.\nApproach: Modify the AspectGetter in NameColumn.cs. Check if the item is a ContainerInfo. If it is, use GetRecursiveChildList() to count the number of descendant nodes with TreeNodeType.Connection and append this count to the formatted name (e.g., \"Name (Count)\")."
 }

diff --git a/mRemoteNG/UI/Controls/ConnectionTree/NameColumn.cs b/mRemoteNG/UI/Controls/ConnectionTree/NameColumn.cs
index 3832bfd66..ff197bc09 100644
--- a/mRemoteNG/UI/Controls/ConnectionTree/NameColumn.cs
+++ b/mRemoteNG/UI/Controls/ConnectionTree/NameColumn.cs
@@ -2,6 +2,9 @@
 using mRemoteNG.Connection;
 using mRemoteNG.Tools;
 using System.Runtime.Versioning;
+using mRemoteNG.Container;
+using mRemoteNG.Tree;
+using System.Linq;
 
 namespace mRemoteNG.UI.Controls.ConnectionTree
 {
@@ -15,7 +18,15 @@ namespace mRemoteNG.UI.Controls.ConnectionTree
             AspectGetter = item =>
             {
                 var ci = (ConnectionInfo)item;
-                return ConnectionNameFormatter.FormatName(ci);
+                var name = ConnectionNameFormatter.FormatName(ci);
+
+                if (ci is ContainerInfo container)
+                {
+                    var count = container.GetRecursiveChildList().Count(child => child.GetTreeNodeType() == TreeNodeType.Connection);
+                    return $"{name} ({count})";
+                }
+
+                return name;
             };
             ImageGetter = imageGetterDelegate;
             AutoCompleteEditor = false;
